title: Bio-Android Nursery Adventure #15
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Incubation Chamber
rooms.description: A sterile white room filled with rows of glowing bio-pods. Each pod contains a developing bio-android suspended in luminescent blue fluid. Soft humming from life support systems fills the air. Monitoring screens display vital signs and development stages. A maintenance station sits against the far wall.

items.name: maintenance workstation
items.description: A metal workstation with tools and diagnostic equipment. It has two storage compartments.

items.name: bio-android development log
items.description: A digital tablet displaying development records
items.text: Development Log Entry: Project Genesis initiated in year 2157. Lead scientist Dr. Aria Chen oversees all bio-android production. Current batch designation: Alpha-7. Remember: All androids are created in the Genesis Lab and maintained by the Synthesis Division.

items.name: maintenance access keycard
items.description: A plastic keycard with a blue stripe labeled 'Maintenance Access'

items.name: bio-pod 17
items.description: A cylindrical pod with a viewing window. Something is tucked behind the control panel.

items.name: crumpled research notes
items.text: Dr. Chen's Notes: Emergency protocol requires knowledge of facility operations. Control Center access restricted to authorized personnel. Security questions based on project fundamentals. The androids' neural patterns are stored in the Memory Core.

items.name: locked supply cabinet
items.description: A tall metal cabinet with a keycard reader

items.name: neural interface device
items.description: A handheld device used for android diagnostics and programming

items.name: reinforced security door
items.description: A heavy door with a keycard reader leading to the Control Center

rooms.name: Control Center
rooms.description: A high-tech command center with wall-mounted monitors displaying facility schematics and bio-android status reports. Holographic displays float in mid-air showing neural network patterns. A central console dominates the room, and information panels line the walls. An emergency exit door glows red on the east wall.

items.name: main control console
items.description: A sophisticated computer terminal with multiple screens and input devices

items.name: facility operations manual
items.description: A digital manual displayed on a screen
items.text: FACILITY OPERATIONS: Bio-Android Nursery Facility established 2157. Chief Administrator: Dr. Aria Chen. Primary Function: Genesis Lab creates all bio-android units. Synthesis Division handles maintenance and upgrades. Memory Core stores all neural data. Emergency evacuation procedures require supervisor authorization.

items.name: Genesis Lab information panel
items.description: A wall panel with details about the Genesis Lab
items.text: GENESIS LAB: Primary bio-android creation facility. All units begin development here in specialized incubation pods. Initial neural programming occurs during the genesis phase.

items.name: Synthesis Division panel
items.description: A display showing information about the Synthesis Division
items.text: SYNTHESIS DIVISION: Responsible for bio-android maintenance, repairs, and neural upgrades. All post-creation modifications handled by synthesis technicians.

items.name: Memory Core information panel
items.description: A screen displaying Memory Core specifications
items.text: MEMORY CORE: Central storage facility for all bio-android neural patterns, memories, and personality matrices. Backup systems ensure no data loss.

items.name: security equipment locker
items.description: A locker containing emergency equipment and supplies

items.name: emergency locator beacon
items.description: A device that signals for rescue once outside the facility

items.name: emergency exit door
items.description: A red emergency door with a biometric scanner and security terminal. Three security questions are displayed on the screen.

password_questions.question: Who is the Chief Administrator?
password_questions.hint: Check the development log and facility manual

password_questions.question: Where are bio-androids created?
password_questions.hint: Read the information panels about facility operations

password_questions.question: Where are neural patterns stored?
password_questions.hint: Look at the Memory Core information panel

rooms.name: Emergency Exit Bay
rooms.description: You've reached the emergency evacuation area! A large airlock door stands open, revealing a decontamination corridor leading to the outside world. Emergency lights flash green, indicating safe passage. Through the transparent walls, you can see the facility's exterior and freedom beyond.

items.name: open airlock door
items.description: A massive door designed for emergency evacuations, now standing open

items.name: decontamination corridor
items.description: A sterile passage that leads to the outside world

items.name: exit status terminal
items.description: A screen displaying evacuation status and safety protocols
items.text: EVACUATION STATUS: AUTHORIZED. All safety protocols cleared. Exit passage secure. Emergency beacon activated. Rescue en route.

rooms.win_message: SUCCESS! You've navigated through the Bio-Android Nursery and reached the emergency exit. The decontamination process completes, and the outer doors open to reveal the world outside. Your emergency beacon signals for rescue, and you step out into freedom. You win!
